page.title: 12HOME LIFE IN THE EIGHTIES
page.content: People here seem content with their lives; they have either been born to isolation or have deliberately chosen it. There are great contrasts in life styles. Old people at Batworthy buy a little meat and bread, otherwise are entirely self-sufficient for milk,eggs vegetables etc. The house is simply furnished _ no carpets because rain causes floods to pour through the kitchen. If it does the occupants continue normally, wearing gumboots. A solid-fuel Raeburn, piped water and bath and electric light are the sole concessions to the twentieth century. By contrast, retired middle-class people live in luxuriously furnished houses, with modern fitted kitchens and bathrooms. Electricity and oil central heating are labour-saving but expensive. Shopping for food is easy by car in nearby Chagford.
